snippet: The family of the chief executive of a large development company in Beijing teamed up with a Brazilian family long involved in international banking to buy a 40-percent stake in the building.
abstract: Family of Zhang Xin, chief executive of large development company in China, and the Safra family of Brazil, long involved in international banking, team up to buy 40 percent stake in Midtown Manhattan's General Motors Building; deal increases worth of building, already the most valuable office tower in the United States, to $3.4 billion.
lead_paragraph: The family of the chief executive of a large development company in Beijing teamed up with a Brazilian family long involved in international banking to buy a 40-percent stake in the building.

headline.seo: Sell of Minority Stake in G.M. Building Raises Its Value
headline.main: Chinese Developer Gets Minority Stake in G.M. Building
headline.print_headline: Chinese Developer Gets Minority Stake in G.M. Building
